paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: c.643delG (p.Glu215Lys) was detected in a heterozygote state in both the FFPE and blood samples of a 49-year old TNBC patient.

functional_data.summary: This variant causes the substitution of glutamic acid by lysine, which creates a premature stop codon.

variants.additional_notes: This variant has not been reported in any database or research study.
key_quotes: This variant is due to the deletion of guanine nucleotide at exon 8 of BRCA2 gene.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: c.7632_7633delCG (p.Val2545Phe) was detected in the FFPE sample of a 58-year old HGSC patient.

functional_data.summary: This variant causes the substitution of valine amino acid by phenylalanine, which provokes a premature stop codon.

variants.additional_notes: This variant has never been reported before.
key_quotes: This variant is due to the deletion of two nucleotides; guanine and cytosine at exon 16 of BRCA2 gene.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The second copy number alteration detected in our study is a copy number gain, 13q13.1(32930545–32,930,833)× 3 in BRCA2 gene.

functional_data.summary: Copy number gains are not regarded as a cancer driver genetic alterations.

variants.additional_notes: This copy number gain was not detected in the patient’s genomic DNA.
key_quotes: Copy number gains are not regarded as a cancer driver genetic alterations.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were successfully extracted.
